frameDefinitions: Some Protection prevents a Danger from harming an Asset.
An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some  Purpose.
A Host is judged regarding their attitude as a potential host in a guest-host relationship.
This frame contains general words denoting equipment where the Use or purpose is not specified by the lexeme but (typically) by a separate expression.
This frame concerns permanent organizations (the Institutions) with a public character, meaning that they are intended to affect the lives of the public at large in a particular Domain.
A Protagonist is sensitive to a Trigger, which has the potential to cause some kind of reaction in the Protagonist.  '' 'Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are allergic to cats.'
frameExamples: The rubber on her sneakers <t>protected</t> her from the mud.
I ca n't remember how many times he <t>visited</t> ! DNI
I found the board to be very <t>hospitable</t> to Russian graduates.
This is an academic <t>institution</t> comprised largely of entrepreneurs.
Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are <t>allergic</t> to cats.
listRoleDefinitions: The person, entity, or action that prevents harm to an <fen>Asset</fen>.
A situation that could damage the <fen>Asset</fen>.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protection</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
The time when the <fen>Danger</fen> threatens.
The place where the <fen>Danger</fen> threatened the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The sentient entity that is temporarily with the <fen>Entity</fen> in order to fulfil some <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The physical entity that is permanently associated with entities or characteristics that the <fen>Agent</fen> wishes to use for some <fen>Purpose</fen>.  During the visit, the <fen>Agent</fen> matches location with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which a visit is made.
A description of the position of the <fen>Agent</fen> during the visit.
The <fen>Host</fen> is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> towards others as a (potential) host is evaluated.
The <fen>Guest</fen> is the entity which is positively or negatively treated by the <fen>Host</fen>.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the action of the <fen>Host</fen> on which the evaluation of the <fen>Host</fen>'s character is based.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the situation or person that the <fen>Host</fen>'s <fen>Behavior</fen> responds to or is related to.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Host</fen>.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the evaluation.
The complex artifact with a particular use.
A permanent organization with a socially important purpose.
The concern of the <fen>Institution</fen>-- broadly speaking, the aspect of society that they affect.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Institution</fen> is located.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> occurs as the External Argument of the targets in this frame. The <fen>Protagonist</fen> represents the one exhibiting the response to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.

The <fen>Trigger</fen> most commonly occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment>. The <fen>Trigger</fen> is that substance or element which causes a health response in the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The tabloid's deal with the woman</fex> shielded Schwarzenegger.

Other nations tended to muffle or modulate their occasional annoyance with the
country that was their shield <fex>against the Soviet threat</fex>.
Almost 10 years later, that agreement insulated <fex>Microsoft</fex> from liability on copyright claims over the graphical user interface (GUI).
Regardless of the distribution media, USPTO information is safeguarded <fex>before, during, and after dissemination</fex> from improper access and modification.
To make his way on a foreign soil, he needed different guardians from those that protected him <fex>in his own birthplace</fex> .
<fex>Pat's</fex> allergy to dairy products is severe.
Some people are very sensitive <fex>to chemicals in the environment</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Leadership Conference of Women Religious
the Congregation for the Doctrine of Faith
